rca_result.root_cause: Multiple infrastructure vulnerabilities detected: Auto Scaling launch template misconfiguration preventing instance launches, VPN redundancy loss creating network connectivity risks, and high-risk Kafka configuration with replication factor of 1
evidence: AWS_EC2_AUTOSCALING_LAUNCH_TEMPLATE_NOT_FOUND health event indicates missing or deleted launch template
Multiple AWS_VPN_REDUNDANCY_LOSS events indicate VPN tunnel failures across multiple connections
AWS_KAFKA_HIGH_RISK_CONFIG_RF_EQUALS_ONE indicates Kafka cluster has replication factor of 1, creating single point of failure
Multiple AWS_LAMBDA_PLANNED_LIFECYCLE_EVENT events suggest upcoming Lambda runtime deprecations
Pattern matches historical incidents with 0.63-0.67 similarity score

remediation.suggestion: Address critical infrastructure misconfigurations to prevent service disruptions
checklist: Verify Auto Scaling launch template exists and is properly configured
Check VPN connection status and restore redundancy by bringing up failed tunnels
Increase Kafka cluster replication factor from 1 to at least 3 for fault tolerance
Review Lambda functions for upcoming runtime deprecations and plan updates
Implement monitoring alerts for launch template availability and VPN tunnel health
